code: @Manual{,   title = {responseFunctions: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Andrew Punnett},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://primer-e.github.io/responseFunctions}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal responseFunctions provide set useful non-linear response functions.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version responseFunctions GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(responseFunctions)  modskurt(x = 500,          H = 1000,          m = 750,          s = 20,          r = 0.75,          d = 50,          p = 1) #> [1] 800

title: Full modskurt — modskurt
code: modskurt(x, H, m, s, r, d, p)

title: Full modskurt — modskurt
text: x Environmental variable H Height mode m Location mode s Spread r Skewness d Flatness p Pointyness

title: Full modskurt Stan code — modskurt_stan
code: cat(modskurt_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurt(real x, real H, real m, real s, real r, real d, real p) { #>   return H / (r * exp(((x - m)/(r * s) - d) / p) + #>                 (1 - r) * exp(- ((x - m)/((1 - r) * s) + d) / p) - #>                 exp(- d / p) + 1) ^ p; #> }

title: Modskurt with asymmetry allowing
code: modskurtd0(x, H, m, s, r, p)

title: Modskurt with asymmetry allowing
text: x Environmental variable H Height mode m Location mode s Spread r Skewness p Pointyness

title: Modskurt with asymmetry allowing
text: Stan code modskurt asymmetry allowing "exaggeration" / large tails.

title: Modskurt with asymmetry allowing
code: cat(modskurtd0_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurtd0(real x, real H, real m, real s, real r, real p) { #>   return modskurt(x, H, m, s, r, 0, p); #> }

what: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness. — modskurtp1
title: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness. — modskurtp1
Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness. — modskurtp1
code: modskurtp1(x, H, m, s, r, d)

title: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness. — modskurtp1
text: x Environmental variable H Height mode m Location mode s Spread r Skewness d Flatness

title: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness. — modskurtp1

what: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness Stan code. — modskurtp1_stan
title: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness Stan code. — modskurtp1_stan
text: Stan code modskurt asymmetry varied flattening / peakedness

title: Modskurt with Asymmetry and varied flattening / peakedness Stan code. — modskurtp1_stan
code: cat(modskurtp1_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurtp1(real x, real H, real m, real s, real r, real d) { #>   return modskurt(x, H, m, s, r, d, 1); #> }

title: Asymetric Modskurt — modskurtp1d0
text: x Environmental variable H Height mode m Location mode s Spread r Skewness

title: Asymmetric modskurt Stan code. — modskurtp1d0_stan
code: cat(modskurtp1d0_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurtp1d0(real x, real H, real m, real s, real r) { #>   return modskurt(x, H, m, s, r, 0, 1); #> }

title: Symmetric Modskurt — modskurtp1d0r05
text: x Environmental variable H Height mode m Location mode s Spread

title: Symmetric Modskurt Stan code. — modskurtp1d0r05_stan
code: cat(modskurtp1d0r05_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurtp1d0r05(real x, real H, real m, real s) { #>   return modskurt(x, H, m, s, 0.5, 0, 1); #> }

title: Symmetric Modskurt with varying flattening / peakedness Stan code. — modskurtp1r05_stan
code: cat(modskurtp1r05_stan[["source_code"]]) #>  #> real modskurtp1r05(real x, real H, real m, real s, real d) { #>   return modskurt(x, H, m, s, 0.5, d, 1); #> }
